intro: Sinowilsonia henryi var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved sinowilsonia, is a rare evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features elliptical leaves that are typically smooth and glossy, with a deep green color. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
